title: Peter Crouch lifts lid on go-karting accident
text:

Peter Crouch has gone into further detail on the infamous 2007 go-karting incident in which he almost wiped out Liverpool team-mate Dirk Kuyt.

Crouch and his team-mates were preparing for their Champions League last-16 tie with Barcelona when Rafa Benitez opted to take the squad on a team building trip.

Part of the break saw Crouch and Co enjoy a spot of go-karting - but it didn’t exactly go to plan for the experienced striker.

Crouch lost control of his go-kart as Kuyt and Xabi Alonso watched from the sidelines, and it almost ended badly for all concerned.

(Image: REUTERS)

Speaking on an episode of That Peter Crouch Podcast , he said: “We were going round (the track) and I thought ‘This will be funny, I’ll fly into the pits and then slam on (the brakes)'.

“So I flew into the pits and slammed on, and literally the brakes had gone, they’d failed completely - Dirk Kuyt and Alonso were there and I literally was going to kill one of them...so I picked Dirk.

“As I went through it was the best jump you’ve ever seen, like a scissors (jump) - and I went through his (Kuyt's) legs and then back out onto the track.

“I didn’t know what to do - in hindsight someone said to me afterwards ‘why didn’t you just take your foot off the accelerator and cruise to a stop'.

(Image: Getty Images)

"But I decided to keep my foot on the accelerator and James Bond-style dive out of it and then leg it off onto the grass bit, but the car just zoomed off into the side and hit a bale of hay and some fire came out of it.

“I had scratches all over me and was in bits and I walked back to the pits past Sami Hyypia and a few of the lads.

“Rafa looked at me like ‘you idiot’.

"Rafa was fuming - he wouldn't even look at me and I said to him 'I promise you it wasn't my fault, the brakes just failed' and a fella went out and testing the brakes and took it out for a lap and said 'Yep the brakes have gone'.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

"It could have been a hell of a lot worse. I think he (Dirk) understood why I didn't take Alonso out."

Speaking after the incident, Kuyt previously said: "I didn’t join in, as I wanted to rest a small injury, but I went along to watch and picked a safe-looking spot to stand beside the track with Rafa.

"Out of nowhere, Peter Crouch drove straight at me at roughly 35mph. He couldn’t brake!

(Image: REUTERS)

"The only think I could do was jump in the air, and in the end I just managed to jump over Peter, and he crashed into cardboard boxes behind me.

"I was within a whisker of having my ankles torn to pieces, and would surely have missed the Champions League final."

Crouch mentions the incident in his new book 'I, Robot: How To Be A Footballer 2'.

“I was not built for a go-kart," he writes.

"As I was coming into the pits, the brakes had gone and Steven Gerrard, Jamie Carragher, Xabi Alonso and Dirk Kuyt were standing in the way. I thought, ‘Kuyt’s getting it’.

“I went flying into him. He jumped up, I went under him and I went straight into the fence. The go-kart burst into flames.”

Fortunately Kuyt was unharmed and Liverpool went on to reach the Champions League final that season before suffering a heartbreaking defeat by AC Milan.
description: The Liverpool squad were on a team building trip ahead of their crucial Champions League encounter with Barcelona in 2007
